alert.note: Alert for La Garita Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Leadville Vicinity, Lake County Below 11000 Ft; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 25 at 3:28AM MST until December 25 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible higher elevations, with total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches possible lower elevations. * WHERE...Leadville Vicinity and Lake County Below 11000 Feet, Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Feet, La Garita Mountains Above 10000 Feet, and Upper Rio Grande Valley and Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Feet. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 AM MST this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late tonight through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...For the Winter Weather Advisory, plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage. And for the Winter Storm Watch, travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the eastern San Juan Mountains, additional heavy-snow accumulations and strong winds may continue into the early and middle parts of the upcoming week, prolonging significant impacts beyond this weekend.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
